intro: Corniola diffusa, commonly known as the diffuse corniola, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Corniola diffusa is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
